Introduction to momo

Source: vignettes/momo.Rmd
momo.Rmd

The goal of momo is to offer a flexible and fast model that can estimate habitat preferences and fine-scale movement patterns based on tagging data.

Installing and loading momo**

The current version of momo (v0.0.1) requires R \(>= 4.0.0\) and can be downloaded from github as follows.

install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("tokami/momo/momo")

The development version can be installed with:

install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("tokami/momo/momo", ref = "dev")

The package is loaded into the R environment with:

library(momo)
## Loading required package: RTMB

Tagging data

A data set containing all required information can quickly be created by the function sim.momo:

# Simulate a data set with tagging data
sim <- sim.momo()

Fitting momo

The main function to estimate movement paramters is fit.momo:

# Fit the movement model
fit <- fit.momo(sim)

Inspecting results

The package includes a variety of functions that allows to inspect the results:

# Plot the results
plotmomo.compare(sim = sim, fit = fit)

On this page
